org.csstudio.platform.security
Class LoginCallbackHandlerProxy

All Implemented Interfaces:
ILoginCallbackHandler
public class LoginCallbackHandlerProxy
extends Object
implements ILoginCallbackHandler

Represents the Login Callback Proxy for any login callback handlers that are enumerated through the enumerator located in the utility class.

Method Detail

getCredentials

public Credentials getCredentials()
Description copied from interface: ILoginCallbackHandler

Returns the username and password that will be used to authenticate the user. Returns null if username and password could not be retrieved.

Implementations of this method may prompt the user for username and password, for example by displaying a login dialog. Such implementations have to wait for user input before returning. Login modules calling this method therefore should not assume that it will return quickly.

The username and password are returned in a Credentials object. Implementations must not keep references to this object, and callers should discard all references to the returned object as early as possible to prevent passwords from being kept in memory unnecessarily.

Specified by:
getCredentials in interface ILoginCallbackHandler
Returns:
the username and password, or null if username and password could not be retrieved.

getId

public String getId()

getName

public String getName()

signalFailedLoginAttempt

public void signalFailedLoginAttempt()
Description copied from interface: ILoginCallbackHandler

Informs this callback handler that the previous login attempt has failed. If this callback handler is interactive, it will display an error message to the user.

If the login failed due to a wrong username/password, clients must call this method before calling getCredentials again, otherwise getCredentials may return the same credentials as from the previous call.

Specified by:
signalFailedLoginAttempt in interface ILoginCallbackHandler
